items.name: Component_ActionHandler
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: Component_ActionHandler # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_ActionHandler extends ui.Component_Handler ###* * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc. * * @method onDataBundleRestore. * @param Object data - The data-bundle * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context. ### onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) -> @setupEventHandlers() ###* * An action-handler component allows a UI game object to execute * actions. An action can be a method-call of a component or of the scene which * always takes two parameters: Sender and Params. For more info about * UI actions, see help-file. * * @module ui * @class Component_ActionHandler * @extends ui.Component_Handler * @memberof ui * @constructor ### constructor: -> ###* * @property initialized * @type boolean * @protected ### @initialized = no ###* * Counter for delayed/timed actions. * @property waitCounter * @type number * @protected ### @waitCounter = 0 ###* * Indicates if the mouse/touch pointer is inside the UI object's bounds. * @property contains * @type boolean * @protected ### @containsPointer = no ###* * Disposes the component. * * @method dispose ### dispose: -> super gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("keyUp", @object) gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseUp", @object) gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseMoved", @object) ###* * Adds event-handler for mouse/touch events to update the component only if * a user-action happened. * * @method setupEventHandlers ### setupEventHandlers: -> gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("keyUp", @object) gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseUp", @object) gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseMoved", @object) if @object.focusable gs.GlobalEventManager.on "keyUp", ((e) => if Input.release(Input.KEY_RETURN) and @object.ui.focused @object.needsUpdate = yes @executeActions() ), null, @object gs.GlobalEventManager.on "mouseUp", ((e) => contains = Rect.contains(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, @object.dstRect.width, @object.dstRect.height, Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) if contains exec = no actions = actions || @object.actions if actions? for action in actions exec = @checkAction(action) and !@checkActionWait(action) break if exec if exec e.breakChain = yes @executeActions() @object.needsUpdate = yes ), null, @object if @object.actions?.first((a) -> a and (a.event == "onMouseEnter" or a.event == "onMouseLeave" or a.event == "onMouseHover")) gs.GlobalEventManager.on "mouseMoved", ((e) => contains = Rect.contains(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, @object.dstRect.width, @object.dstRect.height, Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) if @containsPointer != contains @containsPointer = contains @object.needsUpdate = yes ), null, @object @object.events.on "action", (e) => if e.actions or e.action @executeAction(if e.actions? then e.actions[0] else e.action) ###* * Sets up associated actions. Each action is validated and specific default values for the action-target * and other options are set if not specified. * * @method setupActions ### setupActions: -> if @object.actions? for action in @object.actions continue unless action if not action.event then action.event = "onAction" if action.wait? then continue if not action.target? then action.target = @object.controller if typeof action.target == "string" if action.target.contains(".") action.target = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(@object, action.target) targets = action.target.split(".") target = gs.ObjectManager.current.objectById(targets[0]) if target? component = target.findComponentById(targets[1]) if not component? target = target.components.where((v) -> typeof v[action.name] == "function").first() else target = component else target = @object action.target = target if action.condition? action.conditions = [action.condition] delete action.condition ###* * Initializes the action-handler. * * @method setup ### setup: -> @initialized = yes @setupEventHandlers() @setupActions() ###* * Updates the action-handler. * * @method update ### update: -> checkAction: (action) -> (action?.event or action?.events) and @checkObject(action) checkActionWait: (action) -> result = no if action.wait? and action.wait > 0 @waitCounter = action.wait action.wait = 0 result = yes return result updateActionTarget: (action) -> if not action.target? then action.target = @object.controller if action.target.exec or typeof action.target == "string" if action.target.exec action.target = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(@object, action.target) targets = action.target.split(".") target = gs.ObjectManager.current.objectById(targets[0]) if target? component = target.findComponentById(targets[1]) if not component? target = target.components.where((v) -> typeof v[action.name] == "function").first() else target = component else target = @object action.target = target canExecuteActions: -> @waitCounter <= 0 and @object.ui.enabled and @object.visible ###* * Executes the specified actions. A single action is only executed if * all assigned events and conditions are true. * * @method executeActions * @return If true there was at least one action executed. Otherwise false ### executeActions: (actions) -> return if not @canExecuteActions() result = no actions = actions || @object.actions if actions? for action in actions continue if not @checkAction(action) break if @checkActionWait(action) @updateActionTarget(action) @executeAction(action) result = yes return result ###* * Executes the specified action if all assigned events and conditions * are true. * * @method executeAction * @param {Object} action The action to execute. ### executeAction: (action) -> target = action.target || @object.target if target? AudioManager.playSound(action.sound) if action.sound target[action.name]?(@object, action.params) ui.Component_ActionHandler = Component_ActionHandler
